title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: This table presents 2024 school enrollment statistics for children in Assam, categorized by age groups (6-14, 7-16, 15-16) and gender. It details the percentage distribution of students across Government, Private, and Other educational institutions, as well as the percentage of out-of-school children.
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Data from 2022 showing the educational status of young children (ages 3 to 8) in Assam. It breaks down enrollment into pre-school categories (Anganwadi, Govt pre-primary, Pvt LKG/UKG), formal schooling (Govt, Pvt, Other), and those not enrolled in any institution.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 3: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2024
description: Data from 2024 showing the educational status of young children (ages 3 to 8) in Assam. It breaks down enrollment into pre-school categories (Anganwadi, Govt pre-primary, Pvt LKG/UKG), formal schooling (Govt, Pvt, Other), and those not enrolled in any institution, enabling comparison with 2022 data.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/ UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 4: % Children by grade and reading level. All children. 2024
description: A 2024 assessment of reading proficiency for children in Assam across Grades I through VIII. The table displays the percentage of students at different reading milestones: recognizing letters, reading words, reading Standard I level text, and reading Standard II level text.
data: | Std | Not even letter | Letter | Word | Std I level text | Std II level text | Total |

title: Table 5: Trends over time
description: Longitudinal trend analysis (2014-2024) of reading skills for Standard III students in Assam. It specifically tracks the percentage of children who can read Standard II level text, comparing performance in Government versus Private schools over the decade.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 6: Trends over time
description: Multi-year comparison (2014-2024) of foundational reading abilities for students in Standard V and Standard VIII in Assam. The table shows the percentage of students in these higher grades who can read Standard II level text, segmented by Government and Private school enrollment.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text |
| Year | Govt | Pvt | Govt & Pvt* | Govt | Pvt | Govt & Pvt* |

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
description: A 2024 numeracy assessment for students in Grades I through VIII in Assam. It categorizes children based on their highest arithmetic capability, ranging from number recognition (1-9, 10-99) to performing subtraction and division.

title: Table 8: Trends over time
description: Historical trend data (2014-2024) regarding the arithmetic skills of Standard III students in Assam. It tracks the percentage of children capable of doing at least subtraction, broken down by government and private school sectors.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction |

title: Table 9: Trends over time
description: Time-series data (2014-2024) illustrating the division competency of Standard V and Standard VIII students in Assam. The table compares the percentage of students who can perform division in government versus private schools over time.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division |

title: Table 11: Smartphone availability and use among 14-16-year-olds. By sex. 2024

title: Table 15: Trends over time
description: Sample size details for school surveys conducted in Assam across selected years (2010, 2018, 2022, 2024), categorized by the number of primary and upper primary schools visited.

title: Table 16: Trends over time
description: Trends in student and teacher attendance rates in Assam's Primary and Upper Primary schools, comparing average presence percentages across survey years from 2010 to 2024.

title: Table 17: Trends over time
description: Trends regarding school size in Assam (2010-2024), specifically tracking the percentage of Primary and Upper Primary schools meeting specific small-enrollment criteria over time.

title: Table 18: Multigrade classes. 2024

title: Table 20: Trends over time
description: Comprehensive infrastructure survey of Assam schools (2010-2024), tracking the availability and usability of facilities including mid-day meals, drinking water, toilets (general and girls'), libraries, electricity, and computers.
data: | Mid-day meal | Mid-day meal served in school on the day of visit | 67.3 | 64.0 | 66.3 | 83.0 |
| Mid-day meal | Kitchen/shed for cooking mid-day meal | 80.2 | 92.2 | 91.2 | 90.4 |
| Drinking water | No facility for drinking water | 23.2 | 17.5 | 8.5 | 10.2 |
| Drinking water | Facility but no drinking water available | 16.0 | 14.5 | 13.2 | 10.4 |
| Toilet | Facility but toilet not useable | 47.8 | 75.6 | 16.2 | 17.6 |
| Girls' toilet | No separate provision for girls' toilet | 52.2 | 13.3 | 12.8 | 15.1 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision but locked | 18.5 | 62.2 | 7.9 | 6.1 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked but not useable | 15.6 | 8.5 | 9.0 | 11.1 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked and useable | 13.7 | 16.0 | 70.2 | 67.7 |
| Library | Library but no books being used by children on the day of visit | 10.3 | 34.3 | 38.5 | 36.0 |
| Library | Library books being used by children on the day of visit | 10.5 | 38.8 | 34.2 | 41.2 |
| Electricity | Of schools with electricity connection, % schools with electricity available on the day of visit |  | 80.1 | 82.0 | 90.6 |
| Computer | No computer available for children to use | 98.3 | 93.5 | 91.4 | 88.4 |
| Computer | Computer available but not being used by children on the day of visit | 1.6 | 5.0 | 7.0 | 9.0 |
| Computer | Computer being used by children on the day of visit | 0.2 | 1.6 | 1.6 | 2.6 |

title: Table 21: Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) activities. 2024
description: Implementation status of Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) initiatives in Assam for the 2023-24 and 2024-25 academic years. This table covers government directives, teacher training (online and offline), material distribution (TLM), and school readiness programs for Primary and Upper Primary schools.
